from stackoverflow:

def pairwise_dist(x, y):
    xx, yy, zz = torch.mm(x,x.t()), torch.mm(y,y.t()), torch.mm(x, y.t())
    rx = (xx.diag().unsqueeze(0).expand_as(xx))
    ry = (yy.diag().unsqueeze(0).expand_as(yy))
    P = (rx.t() + ry - 2*zz)
    return P

torch_pairwise_distance[source]

{% endraw %}

Wow torch.nn.PairwiseDistance seems to be 10x faster than pairwise_dist_gram

{% raw %} 
pdist(positions, method='torch')

tensor([2.0000, 8.0000, 2.0000])
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
%timeit pdist(positions, method='torch')

164 µs ± 2.3 µs per loop (mean ± std. dev. of 7 runs, 10000 loops each)
